tech_news.title: Dell’s XPS revival is a welcome reprieve from the “AI PC” fad - Ars Technica
tech_news.description: Dell moves from pushing "AI PCs" and back to what matters in laptops.

tech_news.title: The 4 coolest new products Acer announced at CES 2026 - Mashable
How (not) to recycle those old gadgets - The Washington Post
tech_news.description: E-waste can be transformed into essentials if you’re willing to think outside the box.

tech_news.title: Power bank feature creep is out of control - The Verge
tech_news.description: Power banks now feature integrated cables, kickstands, flashlights, 4G hotspots, giant display, Wi-Fi radios when cheap and basic is usually better.

tech_news.title: This 16-inch laptop is so light I can easily lift it with three fingers - The Verge
tech_news.description: Asus is introducing an ultra-light Zenbook A16 to accompany its refreshed A14 model.

tech_news.title: Two Chrome Extensions Caught Stealing ChatGPT and DeepSeek Chats from 900,000 Users - The Hacker News
tech_news.description: Security researchers found two Chrome extensions with 900,000 installs secretly collecting ChatGPT and DeepSeek chats and browsing data.

tech_news.title: Roborock launches its first robot lawn mower in the US - The Verge
tech_news.description: Roborock’s next robot lawn mower, the RockMow X1 LiDAR, is coming to the US. Unveiled at CES 2026, the bot will arrive later this year with 360-degree 3D scanning.

tech_news.title: Robot Vacuum Maker Roborock Shows Off Stair-Climbing Model With Legs - Bloomberg.com
tech_news.description: Roborock, a Chinese robotic vacuum cleaner brand, unveiled a concept device with two legs that can climb stairs in people’s homes, a flashy example of efforts to sell ordinary consumers on the idea of home robots.

tech_news.title: I played Resident Evil Requiem's terrible prequels so you don't have to - Polygon
tech_news.description: Alyssa Ashcroft made her series debut in Resident Evil Outbreak, a dated multiplayer game that's a nightmare to play now
